sen.j: 小手子（こてこ）は崇峻天皇の妃である。
sen.e: Koteko is a wife of Emperor Sushun.
Koteko was a wife of Emperor Sushun.
Koteko was a wife of Emperor Sushun.

sen.j: 小手子は、蘇我氏により暗殺された第32代天皇崇峻天皇（すしゅんてんのう、在位587年-592年）の妃。
sen.e: Koteko is a wife of Emperor Sushun (reign; 587 - 592) who was assassinated by the SOGA family.
Koteko was a wife of the 32nd emperor of Japan, Emperor Sushun (reign; 587 - 592) who was assassinated by the SOGA clan.
Koteko was a wife of the 32nd emperor of Japan, Emperor Sushun (reign; 587 - 592) who was assassinated by the SOGA clan.

sen.j: 大伴糠手子（おおとものむらじぬかて）の娘。
sen.e: She is a daughter of OTOMO no Murajinukate.
She was a daughter of OTOMO no Murajinukate.
She was a daughter of OTOMO no Murajinukate.

sen.j: 崇峻天皇との間に蜂子皇子と錦代（にしきて）皇女の一男一女を儲ける。
sen.e: She had a daughter; Princess Nishikite and a son; Prince Hachinoko with Emperor Sushun.
Koteko and Emperor Sushun had one son and one daughter, Hachiko no oji (Prince Hachiko) and Nishikite no ojo (Princess Nishikite).
Koteko and Emperor Sushun had one son and one daughter, Hachiko no oji (Prince Hachiko) and Nishikite no ojo (Princess Nishikite).

sen.j: 日本書紀には、小手子が天皇の寵愛が衰えたことを恨み、献上された猪を見て天皇が漏らした「何の時かこの猪の頸を断るがごとく朕が嫌しと思うところの人を断らむ」という独り言を、蘇我馬子に密告したことが、天皇暗殺事件のきっかけとなったという記述がある。
sen.e: In the Nihonshoki, there is a description that she secretly informed to SOGA no Umako that the Emperor said to himself that he wants to cut of the head of the man he hates just like this wild boar"

In the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), there is a description that Koteko, who was resentful about the Emperor whose love toward her had withered away, secretly informed SOGA no Umako of the words the Emperor had said to himself when he saw a boar presented to him, "Some day I will kill the man I hate just like cutting off the boar's head," which triggered assassination of the Emperor.
sen.cmt: (Chronicles of Japan)を追加しました。Informedの後のtoは不要ですので削除しました。「小手子が天皇の寵愛が衰えたことを恨み、献上された猪を見て」および「天皇暗殺事件のきっかけとなった」の部分が訳抜けです。ほぼ全文書き換えました。
sen.e: In the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), there is a description that Koteko, who was resentful about the Emperor whose love toward her had withered away, secretly informed SOGA no Umako of the words the Emperor had said to himself when he saw a boar presented to him, "Some day I will kill the man I hate just like cutting off the boar's head," which triggered assassination of the Emperor.

sen.j: 小手子には、現在の福島県川俣町に落ち延びて養蚕を伝えたという「小手姫（おてひめ）伝説」がある。
sen.e: There is a legend of Koteko escaped to Kawamata-machi, Fukushima Prefecture today and brought sericulture, called "legend of Otehime".

A legend of Koteko called "Otehime densetsu" (Legend of Princess Koteko) has it that Koteko escaped safely to Kawamata-machi, Fukushima Prefecture (referred to by today's place names) and introduced sericulture to the place.
sen.cmt: 原訳のlegend oｆ Koteko escaped はlegend that Koteko escapedとすべきであり文法のミスです。ほぼ全文書き換えました。またOtehimeが小手子であることを明確にするため(Legend of Princess Koteko)を追加しました。
sen.e: A legend of Koteko called "Otehime densetsu" (Legend of Princess Koteko) has it that Koteko escaped safely to Kawamata-machi, Fukushima Prefecture (referred to by today's place names) and introduced sericulture to the place.

sen.j: 小手子の子、蜂子皇子は厩戸皇子（聖徳太子）の計らいで京を逃れ、山形県鶴岡市の出羽三山の開祖となったと伝えられる。
sen.e: Prince Hachinoko, son of Koteko, escaped from the capital at the discretion of Prince Umayado (Prince Shoutoku), and is said to become the Founder of Dewa Sanzan in Tsuruoka City, Yamagata Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is said that Koteko's son, Prince Hachiko, escaped from the capital at the discretion of Prince Umayado (Prince Shotoku), and became the founder of Dewa Sanzan (Three Sacred Mountains of Dewa) in Tsuruoka City, Yamagata Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 原文の順番通り、「Koteko's son」を「Prince Hachiko,」の前に置き換えました。Hachinoko→Hachiko Shoutoku→Shotoku 原文ダブり（後列との重複）削除しました。 Dewa Sanzan の後に(Three Sacred Mountains of Dewa)を追加しました。 「伝えられる」内容は先行する文全体と考えIt is said thatを文頭に置き,原訳中のis said to becomeをbecameとしました。 Founder→founder
sen.e: It is said that Koteko's son, Prince Hachiko, escaped from the capital at the discretion of Prince Umayado (Prince Shotoku), and became the founder of Dewa Sanzan (Three Sacred Mountains of Dewa) in Tsuruoka City, Yamagata Prefecture.

sen.j: 小手子も、蜂子皇子を捜し求めて、実父と娘・錦代皇女とともに東北に落ち延びた。
sen.e: Koteko also escaped to the northeastern region, searching for the prince, with her own father and daughter, Princess Nishikite.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Koteko also fled to Tohoku region with her own father and her daughter, Princess Nishikite, searching for Prince Hachiko,
sen.cmt: the prince →Prince Hachikoとしました。with her own father and daughter, Princess Nishikiteは前半の英文の直後においたほうが意味が明確になると考えます。ほぼ全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Koteko also fled to Tohoku region with her own father and her daughter, Princess Nishikite, searching for Prince Hachiko,

sen.j: 旅の途中に錦代皇女を亡くした小手子は、故郷の大和の風情に似た、現在の福島県伊達郡川俣町や伊達市 (福島県)月舘町の地域にとどまり、桑を植え養蚕の技術を人々に広めたという。
sen.e: Losing Princess Nishikite during the escape, Koteko stayed around the area, which is in Kawamata-machi, Date-gun, Fukushima Prefecture or in Tsukidate-machi, Date City, Fukushima Prefecture today, where exists similar atmosphere to her hometown, Yamato Province, and she planted mulberry trees and passed on the art of sericulture to the people.

It is said that after losing Princess Nishikite during the escape, Koteko stayed in the regions having similar atmosphere to her hometown, Yamato Province, which regions are present Kawamata-machi, Date-gun, Fukushima Prefecture and Tsukidate-machi, Date City, Fukushima Prefecture, and she planted mulberry trees there and passed on the art of sericulture to the people living there.
sen.cmt: It is said that afterを文頭に追加しました。around the area, which is in Kawamata-machi, Date-gun, Fukushima Prefecture or in Tsukidate-machi, Date City, Fukushima Prefecture today, where exists similar atmosphere to her hometown, Yamato Province, をthe regions having similar atmosphere to her hometown, Yamato Province, which regions are present Kawamata-machi, Date-gun, Fukushima Prefecture and Tsukidate-machi, Date City, Fukushima Prefecture, としました。thereをtreesの後に追加、またliving there を文末に追加。
sen.e: It is said that after losing Princess Nishikite during the escape, Koteko stayed in the regions having similar atmosphere to her hometown, Yamato Province, which regions are present Kawamata-machi, Date-gun, Fukushima Prefecture and Tsukidate-machi, Date City, Fukushima Prefecture, and she planted mulberry trees there and passed on the art of sericulture to the people living there.

sen.j: その後小手子は、蜂子皇子に会えないことを悲嘆して、川俣町大清水地内にある清水に身を投げたと伝えられている。
sen.e: It is said that she drowned herself in clear water, lamenting for not being able to see Prince Hachinoko, in Ooshimizu, Kawamata-machi.
It is said that lamenting over not being able to see Prince Hachiko, she drowned herself in clear water in Oshimizu, Kawamata-machi.
sen.cmt: Prince Hachinoko→Prince Hachiko lamenting から始まる句をthatの直後に移動しました。Ooshimizu→Oshimizu
sen.e: It is said that lamenting over not being able to see Prince Hachiko, she drowned herself in clear water in Oshimizu, Kawamata-machi.

sen.j: 川俣町付近には小手姫にちなむ史跡等が残り、月舘町は「小手姫の里」として商工会が中心となって町おこしを行っている。
sen.e: There exist several historic sites related to Otehime around Kawamata-machi area, so Tsukidate-machi, mainly their commerce and industry association, is carrying out their promotion campaign as "hometwon of Otehime".

There exist several historic sites related to Otehime in and around Kawamata-machi, and Tsukidate-machi is carrying out a campaign to promote the town as "Otehime no sato" (the town Otehime lived in), led by the commerce and industry association of the town.
